Mission: Make Pizza AI-Ready 🍕🤖
Business Context: A Slice of Change
We’ve  been  in  the  pizza  business  for  decades.  Our  legendary  Margherita  built  this  empire.  Families,
students, midnight

built  this  empire.  Families,
students, midnight snackers—you name it, they’ve all come to us. Life was simple: people ordered pizzas via
our classic web interface, and we delivered happiness in a b

c web interface, and we delivered happiness in a box.
But the world is changing.
AI agents are rapidly becoming the new interface layer. People now expect to just say, "Order me a pizza," to
their vir

pect to just say, "Order me a pizza," to
their virtual assistants, and the system magically handles the rest. Our web traffic is dropping. Our phones
are quiet. AI agents are the new customers, and we

are quiet. AI agents are the new customers, and we’re not yet ready for them.
We want to open our pizza APIs to the agentic world. But manually rewriting our systems into Model
Context Protocol (MCP)

ing our systems into Model
Context Protocol (MCP) is slow, painful, and not scalable.
We need you to help us make the leap.
The Challenge: Bring Pizza to the AI Ecosystem
Objective
Your mission is to

to the AI Ecosystem
Objective
Your mission is to  build a system that automatically transforms OpenAPI specifications into fully
functional MCP servers.
We want our pizza APIs to be discoverable, acc

rs.
We want our pizza APIs to be discoverable, accessible, and usable by AI agents like ChatGPT, Copilot,
Gemini, and beyond.
But that’s not all—we want you to prove this works by building cooperating

nt you to prove this works by building cooperating agents that can complete a
real-world pizza order and scheduling workflow.
Problem Requirements
Phase 1: OpenAPI to MCP Automation
Build a system tha

se 1: OpenAPI to MCP Automation
Build a system that ingests OpenAPI specifications and automatically generates a fully compliant
MCP server.
The MCP server must expose all relevant endpoints (menu lis

erver must expose all relevant endpoints (menu listing, order placement, order tracking)
with appropriate tool definitions and structured context.
• 
• 
1
Important: You do not need to spend significa

• 
1
Important: You do not need to spend significant time developing the traditional REST APIs
for the pizza system backend. You can freely mock the data, use a lightweight database, or
simulate backe

ata, use a lightweight database, or
simulate backend responses however you prefer. You will not be evaluated on the quality
of the REST APIs themselves, but on how well you translate them to a functio

s, but on how well you translate them to a functional MCP
server.
Phase 2: Pizza Ordering Agent
Develop an AI agent that connects to the newly generated MCP server.
This agent should:
Take a user’s pi

ed MCP server.
This agent should:
Take a user’s pizza order via natural language.
Interact with the MCP server to place the order.
Retrieve and manage order details like order_id  and estimated prepar

order details like order_id  and estimated preparation time.
Phase 3: Scheduling / Coordination Agent
Build a second AI agent that communicates with the ordering agent via Agent-to-Agent (A2A)
protoc

the ordering agent via Agent-to-Agent (A2A)
protocols.
The scheduling agent must:
Use an existing public MCP server (you may select a calendar API, scheduling API, or any other
MCP-enabled service).
C

heduling API, or any other
MCP-enabled service).
Coordinate with the ordering agent to either:
Schedule a delivery time, or
Surprise us with a creative workflow. (We encourage novel, unexpected applic

e workflow. (We encourage novel, unexpected applications.)
Real-World Flow Example
User: "I’d like to order a large Margherita."
Ordering Agent: Places the order via the generated MCP server → Returns

s the order via the generated MCP server → Returns order confirmation and
passes details to the scheduling agent.
Scheduling Agent: Uses an external MCP server (e.g., Google Calendar MCP) → Schedules

CP server (e.g., Google Calendar MCP) → Schedules a delivery
time or performs another relevant task.
Agents exchange updates: User is kept informed about order and delivery status.
Bonus: If you creat

out order and delivery status.
Bonus: If you create additional creative agent behaviors, multi-step workflows, or integrations, you
will earn extra consideration.

you deem appropriate.
We encourage creative and pragmatic use of the AI ecosystem.

ility of the OpenAPI-to-MCP

Problem Solving

ing of Ambiguities: How you make decisions where details are intentionally left unspecified.

iqueness of your workflow.
